title: Electroweak Symmetry Restoration and Radiation Amplitude Zeros
abstract:
In high-energy collisions far above the electroweak scale, one expects that
the effects of the electroweak symmetry breaking become parametrically small
$\delta \sim M_W/E$. In this sense, the electroweak gauge symmetry is restored:
$(i)$ the physics of the transverse gauge bosons and fermions is described by a
massless theory in the unbroken phase; $(ii)$ the longitudinal gauge bosons
behave like the Goldstone bosons and join the Higgs boson to restore the
unbroken $O(4)$ symmetry in the original Higgs sector. Using the unique feature
of the radiation amplitude zeros in gauge theory, we propose to study the
electroweak symmetry restoration quantitatively by examining the processes for
the gauge boson pair production $W^\pm \gamma,\ W^\pm Z$ and $W^\pm H$ at the
LHC and a future muon collider.
